result.execSummary:
The defendant Zackary J Vesper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/1/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zackary J Vesper

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

08:50 AM Defendant Zackary J Vesper in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court. 

Court orders the following:	
Fine:  $316
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Surcharges: Defendant to pay $50 /month commencing 9/01/22 and each month thereafter until satisfied.  Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of payment of all costs/fees, and no new law violations for the next 6 months. If the Defendant has any further violations, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Letter from Attorney Herbers requesting a plea/sentencing date. The hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 9:00 AM will be converted to a plea/sentencing hearing.

08:39 AM Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Zackary J Vesper did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.
Case called for Status of Counsel.
Defense has received discovery, but has not received an offer.
State sending offer. 
  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to Appear filed by Atty Herbers

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Herbers

09:42 AM Defendant Zackary J Vesper in court.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant qualifies for public defender representation.
Court sets hearing for status of counsel to allow Public Defender time to appoint.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with witnesses A & B/McDonalds listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:15 AM Defendant Zackary J Vesper in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 04/27/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
